item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 26, 2025 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Friendship Recession: The Lost Art of Connecting (121 points | 58 comments)
2. An end to all this prostate trouble? (159 points | 63 comments)
3. Cloth (272 points | 29 comments)
4. I wrote a book called "Crap Towns". It seemed funny at the time (290 points | 208 comments)

9. Freshpaint (YC S19) is hiring back end and front end engineers (Remote, US only) ( | hide)
10. First and 2nd gen Nest Thermostats will lose support in Oct 2025 (37 points | 24 comments)
11. Writing "/etc/hosts" breaks the Substack editor (580 points | 311 comments)
12. Wikipedia’s nonprofit status questioned by D.C. U.S. attorney (650 points | 559 comments)
13. Mike Lindell's lawyers used AI to write brief–judge finds nearly 30 mistakes (79 points | 47 comments)

19. Show HN: Formalizing Principia Mathematica using Lean (150 points | 30 comments)
20. Eurorack Knob Idea (290 points | 108 comments)
21. Reproducibility project fails to validate dozens of biomedical studies (216 points | 102 comments)
22. Show HN: Empty Enter Expander – Type less in the terminal with this tool (38 points | 17 comments)
23. Reading RSS content is a skilled activity (80 points | 43 comments)
24. A $20k American-made electric pickup with no paint, no stereo, no screen (1245 points | 1087 comments)
25. Colossal Cave Adventure (1976) (40 points | 18 comments)
26. Apparently Bluesky has one centralized service, the "relay" (77 points | 43 comments)
27. I designed my LED matrix PCB with code (94 points | 41 comments)
28. Avoiding skill atrophy in the age of AI (246 points | 260 comments)
29. GCC 15.1 (263 points | 134 comments)
30. Your phone isn't secretly listening to you, but the truth is more disturbing (73 points | 60 comments)
